metadata.title: CVE-2015-8011 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in the lldp_decode function in daemon/protocols/lldp.c inlldpd before 0.8.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(daemon crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via vectors involvinglarge management addresses and TLV boundaries.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8011` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lldpd - 0.7.19-1
No subscription required

openvswitch-common - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-pki - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-source - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-switch - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-switch-dpdk - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-test - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-testcontroller - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
openvswitch-vtep - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
python3-openvswitch - 2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lldpd package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.19-1').
openvswitch package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.13.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.3').
